intro: Phalaenopsis amabilis var. papuana, commonly known as the Papuan phalaenopsis, is a tropical orchid native to the highlands of New Guinea. It is characterized by its long, slender pseudobulbs and clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically produces 3–5 flower spikes per inflorescence, each bearing numerous blooms that can last several months. It prefers bright, indirect light and consistent moisture, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its unique appearance and long blooming period contribute to its ornamental value in horticulture.
